name: Optellum
slogan: Early lung cancer diagnosis & treatment with AI
description:
Optellum was founded so that every lung cancer patient is diagnosed & treated at the earliest stage, and cured

Optellum’s initial product is the first Decision Support software for personalized early diagnosis & treatment of lung cancer, which enables every clinician, in every hospital, to manage their patients in the optimal way. It is based on Machine Learning technologies applied to the world’s largest clinical dataset.

We are a team of medical device, machine learning, and clinical experts who met at Oxford’s renowned computer vision laboratory.  Between us, we have track records of bringing innovation to market through over 10 start-up companies, resulting already in 5 trade-sales and one IPO.Learn more at http://www.optellum.com/.

team.title: Vice-President R&D
team.name: Jerome Declerck
team.bioHtml: Founder & VP R&D @Optellum. Visiting Scientist @University of Oxford. Previously Director Clinical Applications Research @Siemens. PhD @INRIA

team.title: Chairman
team.name: Prof Sir Mike Brady FRS FREng FMedSci
team.bioHtml: Founded Oxford Robotics Research Group; Serial Entrepreneur:  Guidance Ltd., Mirada Solutions, Mirada Medical, Volpara, Perspectum Diagnostics, ScreenPoint

team.title: CEO
team.name: Vaclav Potesil
team.bioHtml: Founder & CEO @Optellum. Previously Product Lead at Hocoma AG. PhD @University of Oxford @University of Cambridge. Passion for @Mountaineering

team.title: Software Engineer
team.name: Vladimir Salin
team.bioHtml: Building MedTech future with @Optellum | Kick-started KYC&AMLproduct at @SwiftDil | Java core fun at @NetCracker | PhD @SSTU

team.title: Operations Manager
team.name: Christine Pichon
team.bioHtml: Graduated from Imperial College MRes of Medical Device Design and Entrepreneurship, full-time at an innovation consulting firm as business development manager.

team.title: Research Scientist
team.name: Carlos Arteta
team.bioHtml: I am a researcher in computer vision and applied machine learning with a main interest in healthcare.

jobs.title: Intern (Assistant Data Scientist, for a range of backgrounds: from data markup to analysis and algorithm development)
jobs.description:
Are you ready to join the fight against cancer and improve the lives of millions of patients?
Do you want to work with machine learning technologies that will redefine medicine?
Join the Optellum team and help us shape the cancer care of tomorrow!


Internship (Assistant Data Scientist -  we have  projects that suit a range of backgrounds, from data mark-up through to algorithms and analysis at PhD level, including Master thesis and end of studies internships). 


Your Mission: Would you like to
•	Help bring to market healthcare AI products that will be deployed to thousands of hospitals? 
•	Help create datasets to teach AI algorithms in close collaboration with world-leading clinical and AI experts?

Required Skills: You must have  
•	Passion for biomedical topics. 
•	For analysis and algorithms projects: Strong programming and/or analytical skills 
•	For data markup projects: Obsessive attention to detail, strong work ethics 
•	Solid communication skills and ability to write clear documents. Ability to communicate with technical and clinical teams.  
•	Flexibility to feel at home in a technology start-up with a team of developers and scientists.
•	Initial full-time availability for a minimum of 6 weeks and/or part-time (20h/week+) for a minimum of 12 weeks.
•	ELIGIBILITY TO WORK IN THE UK.  WE CANNOT SPONSOR VISA FOR INTERNS.  Please do not apply if you need visa.


Desirable Skills: One or more of these would be a definite plus
•	Studying towards a strong degree in a scientific, medical, or a technical discipline 
•	Basic programming & data analysis skills (e.g. Python, Matlab, R), to effectively import, verify, rearrange & edit data
•	Hands-on software development and/or machine learning experience. Basic database knowledge (SQL or similar) a plus. 
•	Prior experience in a clinical or a research environment. Experience working in a startup or a small SME a plus. 
•	Starting date as soon as possible. Long-term availability (3 months+) is a plus, due to the significant learning curve

What We Offer
•	Opportunity to gain hands-on experience of cutting edge healthcare technologies, particularly relating to machine learning 
•	Work alongside leading clinical, machine learning and medical product development experts.
•	Competitive salary and additional benefits which will grow with the company.
•	Flexible working hours designed around a core period. Additional flexibility may be negotiable.
•	The possibility of a full-time role in our fast-growing company if you demonstrate you have what it takes
•	Beautiful office in Oxford’s historical center, with great connectivity (5-min walk to the train station, 1hr to central London).

jobs.title: Intern (Assistant Data Scientist, for medics)
jobs.description:
Are you ready to join the fight against cancer and improve the lives of millions of patients? 
Do you want to work with machine learning technologies that will redefine medicine? 
Join the Optellum team and help us shape the cancer care of tomorrow!

Internship (Assistant Data Scientist - for medical students).

Your Mission: Would you like to 
•	Help bring to market healthcare AI products that will be deployed to thousands of hospitals? 
•       Help create huge curated datasets for machine learning? (based primarily on CT imaging and ground-truth outcomes & image markups, you will check for consistency & improve for the needs of AI/machine learning systems) 
•       Develop unique data science skills, while working in a world-class team of AI experts, in close collaboration with the University of Oxford. 
	
Required Skills: You must have 
•	Studying for a medical degree (or aiming to start)
•	Obsessive attention to detail, strong work ethics 
•	Passion for technology and biomedical innovations
•	Solid communication skills in English and ability to write clear documents
•	Ability to communicate with clinical and technical R&D teams. 
•	Flexibility to feel at home in a technology start-up with a team of developers and scientists. 
•	Initial full-time availability for a minimum of 6 weeks and/or part-time for a minimum of 12 weeks (min. 20h/week).  
•	ELIGIBILITY TO WORK IN THE UK.  WE CANNOT SPONSOR VISA FOR INTERNS FROM OUTSIDE OF THE EU

Desirable Skills: One or more of these would be a definite plus 
•	Basic programming & data analysis skills (e.g. Python, Matlab, R), to effectively import, verify, rearrange & edit data 
•	Familiarity with radiology (Chest Computed Tomography) and health IT (electronic medical records, PACS)
•	Prior experience in a clinical or a research environment. Experience working in a startup or a small SME a plus. 
•	Hands-on software development experience. Basic database knowledge (SQL) a plus. 
•	Starting date as soon as possible. Long-term availability (3 months+) is a plus, due to the significant learning curve


What We Offer 
•	Opportunity to gain hands-on experience of cutting edge healthcare technologies, particularly relating to machine learning and image analysis
•	Work alongside leading clinical, machine learning and medical product development experts. 
•	Close collaboration with clinicians at Oxford University Hospitals and other world-leading hospital project partners. 
•	Competitive salary and additional benefits which will grow with the company. 
•	Flexible working hours designed around a core period. Additional flexibility may be negotiable. 
•	The possibility of a full-time role in our fast-growing company if you demonstrate you have what it takes 
•	Beautiful office in Oxford’s historical center, with great connectivity (5-min walk to the train station, 1hr to central London).

jobs.title: Platform Software Engineer: Help fight cancer with AI
jobs.description:
Are you ready to join the fight against cancer and improve the lives of millions?
Find ways to automate our infrastructure and data pipelines?
Join the Optellum team and help us shape the cancer care of tomorrow!

Platform Software Engineer (AI & Clinical Decision Support Software)

Your Mission:
• Help bring to market AI solutions that will improve cancer care in thousands of hospitals.
• Deploy and configure product releases to the cloud and partner sites.
• Automate our production infrastructure.
• Continuously improve our internal tooling for data curation.

We are looking for people who:
• Are strong communicators who positively influence a small, highly productive team.
• Are passionate, have initiative and produce high quality work.
• Have strong problem solving & analytical skills, while being at ease handling multiple responsibilities at once.

Required, you must have:
• Excellent command of written and spoken English.
• Interest in hospital workflows and infrastructure. You always wanted to look under the lid of hospital IT and meet the people who manage it.
• Good working knowledge of one programming language (Python, Scala, Java or JS).
• Proven ability to deploy web-based software on remote servers or the Cloud using Docker or similar.
• Working knowledge of the core AWS or Google Cloud services.
• Skills to carry out and script elementary Linux sysadmin tasks (bash, networking)
• Ability to travel up to 25% to trade shows, conferences and customer sites to support on-site deployments and demos in hospitals.

Desirable, one or more of these would be a definite plus:
• Passion for biomedical topics
• Previous collaborative software development experience (in industry, startup or open-source projects).
• Experience from a startup or a fast-growing company
• Prior experience and interest to learn more about clinical healthcare IT standards (e.g. DICOM, HL7, FHIR)
• Prior experience and interest to learn more about cyber-security, especially as applied to hospital and patient information.  
• Love of strongly-typed languages.

What we offer:
• Fast growth, ownership & high impact as one of first employees.
• Work with serial entrepreneurs & AI experts from the University of Oxford, and globally leading clinicians - authors of medical guidelines.
• Professional development opportunities in clinical & software engineering.
• Competitive salary and benefits, including possibility of significant equity.
• Flexible working hours from the outset. Working location may be negotiable in the future. 
• Great location in Oxford’s historical center: just 5 min walk to train station, 1h to central London.
• Work permit sponsorship to candidates with relevant industry experience of 2 years or more.

jobs.title: Research Scientist (Machine Learning, Computer Vision): Help fight cancer with AI
jobs.description:
Are you ready to join the fight against cancer and improve the lives of millions of patients?   
Do you want to work with machine learning technologies that will redefine medicine?
Join the Optellum team and help us shape the cancer care of tomorrow!
	

Research Scientist (Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Data Science)


Your Mission: Would you like to
•	Help bring to market AI solutions that will be deployed to improve cancer care in thousands of hospitals? 
•	Create infrastructure that will turn thousands of Terabytes of medical data into novel biomarkers?
•	Work closely with our founders, developers, and world-leading clinical and machine learning luminaries?



Required Skills: You must have
•	Creativity, scientific curiosity and passion for biomedical topics.
•	Strong knowledge of computer vision, machine learning or medical informatics. 
•	Strong programming/coding ability (Python, C++ or similar).
•	Strong Masters degree in a quantitative discipline. PhD a big plus. 
•	The flexibility to feel at home in a start-up, as one of our first employees working closely with the founders.


Desirable Skills: One or more of these would be a definite plus
•	Strong PhD from a world-leading research group.
•  Experience with analyzing medical image and/or electronic patient record data.
• Experience with weakly supervised & unsupervised learning; Natural Language Processing (NLP)
• Previous collaborative software development experience (in industry, startup or open-source projects).
• Experience with any of these is a plus: scientific computing (e.g. SciPy), deep learning (e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow), GP-GPU, big data (e.g.Spark) and/or health IT (ontologies, HL7, FHIR).




What We Offer
•	Fast growth as one of first employees:  full responsibility and freedom in determining your direction.  
•	Work with a world-class team of AI experts, and global leading clinicians- authors of medical guidelines.
•	Competitive salary and benefits, including significant equity.
•	Flexible working hours from the outset. Working location may be negotiable in the future.   
•	Work permit sponsorship to the most exceptional candidates
•	A great location based in Oxford’s historical center and only 1h by train to central London
